description: Kris Kristofferson, a songwriter who became a country star and A-list actor, died at his home on Maui surrounded by family on Saturday, a spokesperson said in an statement.
title: Kris Kristofferson, singer-songwriter and actor, dies at 88

description: Kremlin critic Vladimir Kara-Murza won the Pulitzer Prize for columns he wrote while imprisoned in Russia. Here's how he did it.
title: How to win a Pulitzer while in Russian prison

description: Mexico's production of mezcal has increased exponentially in the last decade. The rapid growth is changing lives at family owned distilleries.
title: Mezcal boom changes lives for Oaxacan families

description: Demand for mezcal was low for years, but interest and sales have soared. The vast majority of the spirit is made in Oaxaca, Mexico, where family-owned distilleries dot the landscape.
title: Mezcal emerges from tequila's shadow as Mexican production grows

description: Caitlin Clark, on a practice court for the WNBA's Indiana Fever, revealed the biomechanics behind her jaw-dropping three-pointers to 60 Minutes correspondent Jon Wertheim.
title: Caitlin Clark breaks down her logo 3

description: After a record-breaking rookie season in the WNBA, Indiana Fever player Caitlin Clark reflects on the standout moment from her year.
title: Caitlin Clark on the standout moment of her first year at the WNBA

description: Basketball fans are packing the stands and tuning in as interest in the WNBA grows.
title: What WNBA rookies, veterans are bringing to league as interest spikes

description: Women's basketball has surged in popularity, but salaries haven't risen to match. WNBA players are hoping to negotiate better contracts in the future.
title: With spike in WNBA viewership, players eye fair share of league revenue

description: It's been a year unlike any the WNBA has seen. Players Caitlin Clark, Napheesa Collier, and Aliyah Boston talk about sold-out arenas and the physicality of the league.
title: Caitlin Clark, Napheesa Collier, Aliyah Boston talk WNBA season

description: Putin critic Vladimir Kara-Murza, who thought he'd die in prison after he received a 25-year sentence, said an FSB agent had parting advice when he was freed during a prisoner swap.
title: Vladimir Kara-Murza says he got warning during Russian prisoner swap

description: National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz explain what went into the negotiations with Russia leading up to the biggest prisoner swap since the Cold War.
title: The assassin critical to the Russian prisoner swap

description: Putin critic Vladimir Kara-Murza was one of eight Russian dissidents freed in the largest international prisoner swap since the Cold War. He says he thought he was going to be executed on the day he was taken from his cell.
title: Freed Putin critic Vladimir Kara-Murza says Russia deserves better

description: Heritage Insurance provided the following statement for 60 Minutes' report Sunday, "After the Hurricane."
title: Statements of Heritage Insurance to 60 Minutes

description: A family expected a large insurance payout after Hurricane Ian devastated their Florida home. Then the check came, and questions about allegedly shortchanged homeowners came with it.
title: Florida home hurricane damage reports changed, whistleblowers say

description: Adjusters in Florida say insurance companies altered Hurricane Ian damage reports to underpay homeowners. Whistleblowers detail what they found.
title: Florida insurers shortchanged homeowners after 2022 hurricane, whistleblowers say

description: Kremlin critic Vladimir Kara-Murza won the Pulitzer Prize for columns he wrote while imprisoned in Russia. Here’s how he did it.
title: How Vladimir Kara-Murza won a Pulitzer Prize from a Russian prison

description: Demand for mezcal was low for years, but interest and sales have soared. The vast majority of the spirit is made in Oaxaca, Mexico, where family-owned distilleries dot the landscape.
title: Mezcal producers preserve traditional methods as demand for liquor grows | 60 Minutes

description: It’s been a year unlike any the WNBA has seen. Players Caitlin Clark, Napheesa Collier, and Aliyah Boston talk about sold-out arenas and the physicality of the league.
title: Caitlin Clark, Napheesa Collier on WNBA’s success in watershed season | 60 Minutes

description: Putin critic Vladimir Kara-Murza was one of eight Russian dissidents freed in the largest international prisoner swap since the Cold War. He says he thought he was going to be executed on the day he was taken from his cell.
title: Putin critic Vladimir Kara-Murza speaking out after prisoner swap | 60 Minutes

description: Adjusters in Florida say insurance companies altered Hurricane Ian damage reports to underpay homeowners. Whistleblowers detail what they found.
title: Florida insurance carriers used altered hurricane damage reports, whistleblowers say

description: Caitlin Clark, on a practice court for the WNBA's Indiana Fever, revealed the biomechanics behind her jaw-dropping three-pointers to 60 Minutes correspondent Jon Wertheim.
title: Caitlin Clark's logo 3: Fever player breaks down her signature shot

description: A SpaceX Crew Dragon spacecraft caught up with the International Space Station and moved in for docking Sunday.
title: SpaceX Crew Dragon brings two fresh crew members to space station

description: Gov. Gavin Newsom on Sunday vetoed a landmark bill aimed at establishing first-in-the-nation safety measures for large artificial intelligence​ models.
title: California governor vetoes first-in-nation AI safety bill

description: People in the northern part of Rockdale County were ordered to evacuate and others were told to shelter in place with windows and doors closed.
title: Residents ordered to evacuate or shelter in place after fire at chemical plant

description: Sen. JD Vance and Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz will face off on Tuesday in the first and only vice presidential debate of the cycle.
title: How Walz and Vance are preparing for the 2024 VP debate

description: Throughout his 50-year career in show business, John Ashton appeared in nearly 100 movies.
title: John Ashton, "Beverly Hills Cop" franchise actor, dies at 76

description: More than 40,000 people reported outages with the music platform on downdetector.com.
title: Spotify temporarily goes down as thousands left without access to tunes

description: After some initial confusion, Vance was permitted to enter and encouraged people to support a small business.
title: Primanti Brothers denies claim Vance was "banned" from entering

description: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Robert Costa speaks to FEMA administrator Deanne Criswell as storm Helene wreaks havoc throughout the southeastern U.S. Plus, former Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan on the 2024 presidential race.
title: 9/29: Face the Nation

description: Missed the second half of the show? the latest on...Amid historic flooding in North Carolina from the remnants from Hurricane Helene, FEMA administrator Deanne Criswell tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that "I don't know that anybody could be fully prepared for the amount of flooding and landslides that they are experiencing right now", Ret. Gen. H.R. McMaster, who served as national security adviser in the Trump administration" tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that "I don't really buy it" that the former president could broker a settlement to the war in Ukraine, and Maryland's former Republican governor, Larry Hogan, who has been backed by former President Donald Trump in the race for U.S. Senate, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that he isn't backing the former president in the 2024 race.
title: Face the Nation: Criswell, McMaster, Hogan

description: On this "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" broadcast, FEMA administrator Deanne Criswell and former Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan join Robert Costa.
title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 29, 2024

description: Maryland's former Republican governor, Larry Hogan, who has been backed by former President Donald Trump in the race for U.S. Senate, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that he isn't backing the former president in the 2024 race. "Neither one of the two candidates has earned my vote, and the voters in the country are going to be able to make that decision," he said.
title: Larry Hogan says "neither one of the two candidates has earned my vote" in presidential race

description: The popular Republican governor, who served from 2015 to 2023, has Trump's endorsement. But Hogan said he won't be voting for the former president.
title: Larry Hogan says "neither one of the two candidates has earned my vote" in presidential race

description: Ret. Gen. H.R. McMaster, who served as national security adviser in the Trump administration" tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that "I don't really buy it" that the former president could broker a settlement to the war in Ukraine, as Trump has claimed.
title: H.R. McMaster says "I don't really buy" that Trump could broker a settlement in Ukraine

description: Ret. Gen. Stanley McChrystal has backed Vice President Kamala Harris in the 2024 presidential race, telling "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that "character is very important, and so I'm voting for character. I'm voting for Kamala Harris."
title: Stanley McChrystal says he is backing Harris because "character is very important"

description: A projection for ORF public television, based on counting of more than half the votes, put support for the Freedom Party at 29.2% and Chancellor Karl Nehammer's Austrian People's Party at 26.3%.
title: Austria's far-right Freedom Party heading for its first national election win

description: Israel's military said Saturday that it had killed Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah, and a cousin of his is already emerging as his replacement who could rule the terrorist organization in a similar fashion, Imtiaz Tyab reports from Tel Aviv.
title: Cousin of slain Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah emerging as his replacement

description: In tonight's expanded edition of 60 Minutes, Cecilia Vega reports from Mexico, where mezcal production has surged as producers work to preserve traditional distillation methods.
title: 60 Minutes reports on mezcal in Mexico

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Larry Hogan, former Maryland governor, on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that aired on Sept. 29, 2024.
title: Transcript: Larry Hogan, former Maryland governor, on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 29, 2024

description: Amid historic flooding in North Carolina from the remnants from Hurricane Helene, FEMA administrator Deanne Criswell tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that "I don't know that anybody could be fully prepared for the amount of flooding and landslides that they are experiencing right now."
title: FEMA administrator on N.C. flooding: "I don't know that anybody could be fully prepared"

description: Amid Israel's attacks that have taken out Hezbollah's top leadership, Republican Sen. Tom Cotton of Arkansas tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that "all of Hezbollah's leadership needs to be eliminated, just like all of its arsenal needs to be eliminated."
title: Sen. Tom Cotton says "all of Hezbollah's leadership needs to be eliminated"

description: Pope Francis, who didn't mention Israel by name and said he was speaking in general terms, said that "the defense must always be proportional to that attack."
title: Pope Francis denounces military attacks that go "beyond morality"

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with H.R. McMaster, CBS News contributor and former National Security Adviser, on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that aired on Sept. 29, 2024.
title: Transcript: H.R. McMaster, former National Security Adviser, on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 29, 2024

title: Open: This is "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 29, 2024

title: Transcript: Ret. Gen. Stanley McChrystal on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Sept. 29, 2024

description: FEMA Administrator Deanne Criswell called the storm "a true multi-state event" that's had "significant impacts" across five states.
title: FEMA administrator on N.C. flooding: "I don't know that anybody could be fully prepared"

description: We leave you this Sunday morning among sunflowers in Highmore, South Dakota. Videographer: Kevin Kjergaard.
title: Nature: Sunflowers in South Dakota

description: The record was broken in deafening fashion at Eden Park rugby stadium in Auckland.
title: New Zealand reclaims world record for largest mass haka

description:
On Tuesday, the Democratic and Republican nominees for vice president will face each other in their first and only debate. Historian Kate Andersen Brower says that, even though Minnesota Governor Tim Walz and Ohio Senator JD Vance both hail from the heartland, viewers should not expect "Midwestern Nice" to play out between the two. CBS News chief election & campaign correspondent Robert Costa looks at the history of VP debates.

[CBS News will host the only planned vice presidential debate between Governor Tim Walz and Senator JD Vance on Tuesday, Oct. 1, at 9 p.m. ET on CBS and CBS News 24/7. Download the free CBS News app for live coverage, post-debate analysis, comprehensive fact checks and more.]
title: The high stakes & low blows of vice presidential debates

description: The bestselling author's latest, "Revenge of the Tipping Point," builds on a familiar idea from his books: You may think you know how the world works, but you're wrong!
title: Malcolm Gladwell's life has changed; he has not

description: Bestselling author Malcolm Gladwell's latest, "Revenge of the Tipping Point," builds on a familiar idea from his books: You may think you know how the world works, but you're wrong! The provocative Gladwell talks with correspondent David Pogue about why he's refused to change his approach, his work ethic, or his contrarianism.
title: Malcolm Gladwell on "Revenge of the Tipping Point"

description: During a stop on their "Music of the Spheres" global tour, which Billboard calls "the biggest rock tour of all time," Chris Martin, Will Champion, Guy Berryman and Jonny Buckland talk about their new album, the songwriting process, and their future playing together.
title: Coldplay on their record-breaking world tour: "We're having such a great time"

description: Twenty-five years after their first hit record, Coldplay's current world tour, which Billboard calls "the biggest rock tour of all time," has earned more than a billion dollars and sold more than 10 million tickets. During a stop in Dublin, correspondent Anthony Mason catches up with Chris Martin, Will Champion, Guy Berryman and Jonny Buckland to talk about "Moon Music" (the band's tenth studio album), the songwriting process, and their future playing together.
title: Coldplay on their record-breaking world tour

description: On the occasion of Jimmy Carter turning 100, President Biden honors the former president and humanitarian for his decades of public service, as well as his hopeful vision of our country and tireless commitment to a better world.
title: President Joe Biden on Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday

description: On the occasion of Jimmy Carter turning 100, President Biden honors the former president and humanitarian for his decades of public service, as well as his hopeful vision of our country and tireless commitment to a better world.
title: President Joe Biden on Jimmy Carter's 100th birthday

description: She was working an economic policy job at the White House when, at age 30, she bought a small specialty food store called the Barefoot Contessa. It started her on a career as an entrepreneur, cookbook author and culinary TV host.
title: Ina Garten on her memoir, and a life of reinvention

description: Ina Garten was working an economic policy job at the White House when, at age 30, she changed direction, buying a small specialty food store called the Barefoot Contessa in West Hampton Beach, New York. It started her on a career as an entrepreneur, cookbook author and culinary TV host. Garten, whose new memoir is "Be Ready When the Luck Happens," talks with correspondent Rita Braver about her painful childhood; her marriage; and what she thinks about the prospect of retiring.
title: Ina Garten: Recipe for success

description: Dame Maggie Smith, whose luminous stage and screen career included two Oscars and a Tony Award, died on Friday, September 27, 2024, at age 89. Correspondent Martha Teichner has a remembrance of the actress whose most famous role came late in life – as the prickly, imperious Lady Violet Crawley in the TV series "Downton Abbey."
title: Remembering "Downton Abbey" actress Maggie Smith

description: Being able to identify hoaxes, avoid scams, and debunk propaganda is a civic skill required in today's information society. That's why the curriculum of students in Finland includes media literacy lessons, aimed at safeguarding a precious resource: the truth. Correspondent Chris Livesay reports.
title: In Finland, classes in recognizing fake news, disinformation

description: Doug Redenius' lifelong fascination with James Bond movies has led him to collect and restore dozens of vehicles used by the British secret agent and the bad guys he pursued, from tripped-out sportscars, submersibles and motorcycles, to planes, helicopters and paragliders. Correspondent Lee Cowan takes a spin through spy movie history, visiting with 007's vehicles, many of which are currently on display at the Griffin Museum of Science and Industry in Chicago.
title: James Bond's wheels: Collecting the coolest

description: Friday's airstrike by the Israeli military that killed Hassan Nasrallah, overall leader of the Iran-backed group Hezbollah, in Beirut, Lebanon, along with the recent explosions of pagers and walkie-talkies carried by Hezbollah members, have now eliminated virtually all of the terrorist group's senior commanders. CBS News national security correspondent David Martin talks with CBS News contributors Andrew Boyd (former head of counter-terrorism operations at the CIA) and Michael Morrell (former acting CIA director) about what these latest developments mean for Israel, and for Iran.
title: Terror expert: Leadership of Hezbollah has been "decapitated"

description: "Sunday Morning" looks back at historical events on this date.
title: Almanac: September 29

description: U.S. Central Command said two of the dead were senior militants affiliated with the extremist Islamic State group and an al-Qaeda-linked group in Syria.
title: U.S. military says it killed 37 militants in Syria airstrikes

description: Parasocial relationships are those that are one-sided – like the fascination and devotion that fans hold for their favorite celebrities. How do they speak to the human condition?
title: Brush with fame: The public's one-sided bond with celebrities

description: Parasocial relationships are those that are one-sided – like the fascination and devotion that fans hold for their favorite celebrities. Correspondent Susan Spencer talks with journalist Jancee Dunn about her experience interviewing her hero, rock star Stevie Nicks; and with experts about how that intense fan-celebrity relationship speaks to the human condition.
title: Starstruck: The public's one-sided bond with celebrities

description: Hezbollah confirmed his death, making him the seventh senior Hezbollah leader slain in Israeli strikes in a little over a week. They include founding members who had evaded death or detention for decades.
title: Israel says it has killed another high-ranking Hezbollah official

description: We travel across the Atlantic Ocean to visit three restaurants in three different European countries, from a chef who owns over a dozen eateries in Portugal to a chef elevating Georgia’s traditional cuisine. Watch these stories and more on The Dish.
title: The Dish: European restaurants

description: Actor, producer and director Zoë Kravitz sits down with Michelle Miller to discuss her directorial debut with the film "Blink Twice." Then, Martha Teichner meets Philippe Petit, the French high-wire artist who walked across a high wire strung between the Twin Towers 50 years ago. "Here Comes the Sun" is a closer look at some of the people, places and things we bring you every week on "CBS Sunday Morning."
title: Here Comes the Sun: Zoë Kravitz and more

description: Did a former Idaho state trooper use his law enforcement skills to stage his wife’s death in their bathtub? "48 Hours" correspondent Peter Van Sant reports.
title: The Bathtub Murder of Kendy Howard

description: The Menendez brothers were given life sentences for gunning down their own parents. Now they’re hoping new evidence could reopen the case. "48 Hours" contributor Natalie Morales reports.
title: The Menendez Brothers’ Fight for Freedom

description: Helene death toll rises, millions still without power; Bear sightings unnerve California communities
title: 9/28: CBS Weekend News
